div1.p: Lazear writes about his trip through France.

div1.head: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, June 30, 1895
div1.p:
I left Fon-
tainebleau yesterday morning
as I wrote that I would
and after a pleasant
days tramp I reached
here just in time to escape
a thunderstorm. This morning
I walked down to Nemours
leaving my baggage here.
At Nemours I had a
swim in the Loing.

The country all around
here is very picturesque.
I think I shall stay in
the neighborhood for several
days. I shall probably
go tomorrow to a
place called Grez, which
is not far from here.
I will be at the Hotel
Chevillon where a telegram
would reach me if sent
any time Monday. Do not
forward any letters there.
It was very pleasant
this morning but this after-
noon it became extremely
hot and now it is
raining.

I have entirely given up
the idea of going to the
Loire. It is attractive enough here and
I am not anxious to see any chateaus.

I hope you are well and that
all is going on well. at
Give my regards to the Townsends
